Fungal Infection.dosage: Apply thin layer to affected area 2-3 times daily
Fungal Infection.safety_notes: External use only. Discontinue if irritation occurs.

Acne.dosage: Start with lower concentrations, apply once daily initially
Acne.safety_notes: May cause dryness, start slowly. Use sunscreen.
Acne.age_restriction: Benzoyl peroxide safe for ages 12+ years

GERD.safety_notes: Take 30-60 minutes before meals. Max 3 courses/year.

Common Cold.safety_notes: Do not exceed recommended doses. Avoid alcohol.
Common Cold.age_restriction: Cough suppressants not recommended under 4 years

Migraine.dosage: Take at first sign of headache. Ibuprofen: 400-600mg
Migraine.duration: Single doses, max 2-3 days consecutive use
Migraine.safety_notes: Take with food to reduce GI irritation

Gastroenteritis.dosage: ORS: 200ml after each loose stool. Loperamide: 2mg after each loose stool, max 8mg/day
Gastroenteritis.source: WHO/UNICEF ORS Guidelines, FDA OTC Antidiarrheal Monograph
Gastroenteritis.safety_notes: Maintain hydration. Avoid loperamide if fever/blood in stool.

Urinary Tract Infection.dosage: Cranberry: 500mg twice daily. Increase water to 8-10 glasses/day
Urinary Tract Infection.source: FDA OTC Urinary Analgesic Monograph (21 CFR 201.302)
Urinary Tract Infection.safety_notes: These provide symptom relief only. See doctor if no improvement in 48 hours.

Osteoarthritis.source: FDA OTC NSAID Monograph, ACR Osteoarthritis Guidelines
Osteoarthritis.safety_notes: Regular monitoring needed for chronic use

Vertigo.source: FDA OTC Motion Sickness Monograph (21 CFR 341.74)

red_category_consultations.AIDS: Requires specialized HIV treatment with antiretroviral therapy. Immediate medical consultation required.
red_category_consultations.Diabetes: Requires prescription medications (insulin/oral hypoglycemics) and medical monitoring. See doctor immediately.
red_category_consultations.Bronchial Asthma: Requires prescription bronchodilators and corticosteroids. Emergency condition during attacks.
red_category_consultations.Hypertension: Requires prescription antihypertensive medications and regular monitoring. Silent killer - see doctor.
red_category_consultations.Cervical Spondylosis: Requires imaging and specialized treatment. May need prescription muscle relaxants/physiotherapy.
red_category_consultations.Paralysis (brain hemorrhage): Medical emergency requiring immediate hospitalization and specialized care.
red_category_consultations.Jaundice: Indicates serious liver condition. Requires immediate medical evaluation and treatment.
red_category_consultations.Malaria: Life-threatening condition requiring prescription antimalarial drugs. Immediate medical attention.
red_category_consultations.Chickenpox: Highly contagious viral infection. May require antiviral prescription drugs, especially in adults.
red_category_consultations.Dengue: Potentially fatal viral infection. Requires immediate medical monitoring for complications.
red_category_consultations.Typhoid: Serious bacterial infection requiring prescription antibiotics. Immediate medical attention.
red_category_consultations.Hepatitis A: Viral liver infection requiring medical monitoring and supportive care.
red_category_consultations.Hepatitis B: Chronic viral infection requiring specialized antiviral treatment and monitoring.
red_category_consultations.Hepatitis C: Chronic viral infection requiring prescription direct-acting antivirals.
red_category_consultations.Hepatitis D: Co-infection with Hepatitis B requiring specialized medical care.
red_category_consultations.Hepatitis E: Acute viral hepatitis requiring medical monitoring, especially in pregnancy.
red_category_consultations.Alcoholic Hepatitis: Serious liver condition requiring immediate medical care and alcohol cessation.
red_category_consultations.Tuberculosis: Serious bacterial infection requiring multiple prescription antibiotics for 6-9 months.
red_category_consultations.Pneumonia: Serious lung infection requiring prescription antibiotics. Can be life-threatening.
red_category_consultations.Heart Attack: Medical emergency requiring immediate hospitalization and specialized cardiac care.
red_category_consultations.Hypothyroidism: Requires lifelong thyroid hormone replacement therapy and monitoring.
red_category_consultations.Hyperthyroidism: Requires prescription antithyroid medications or radioactive iodine treatment.
red_category_consultations.Chronic Cholestasis: Serious liver condition requiring specialized medical evaluation and treatment.
red_category_consultations.Drug Reaction: May require immediate medical attention depending on severity. Discontinue offending drug.
red_category_consultations.Peptic Ulcer Disease: Requires prescription proton pump inhibitors and possible H. pylori treatment.
